Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries
Synopsis The available Rascal libraries.
Details Benchmark Exception Graph IDE IO Java JDT LabeledGraph Message ParseTree PriorityQueue Resources RSF Scripting ValueIO Vis
Description The libraries with functions for built-in datatypes are described elsewhere:
  • Boolean: Boolean values.
  • Constructor: Constructors create values for user-defined datatypes (Algebraic Datatypes).
  • DateTime: Date and time values.
  • Integer: Integer values.
  • List: List values.
  • Location: (Source code) location values.
  • Map: Map values.
  • Node: Node values.
  • Number: Numeric values.
  • Range: Numeric range values.
  • Real: Real values.
  • Relation: Relation values.
  • Set: Set values.
  • String: String values.
  • Tuple: Tuple values.
  • Value: Values of type value.
  • Void: Values of type void.
The libraries described here provide the following additional functionality:
  • Benchmark: Functions for time measurement and benchmarking.
  • Exception: The Exception datatype used in all Rascal exceptions.
  • Graph: A Graph datatype with associated functions.
  • IDE: Extend an IDE with interactive, language-specific, features (Eclipse only).
  • IO: Functions for reading/writing values from/to files.
  • Java: An Entity datatype for representing facts about Java programs.
  • JDT: Datatypes for representing relations between parts of Java programs. See Java for the basic data model for Java artifacts.
  • LabeledGraph: A LabeledGraph datatype with associated functions.
  • Message: A Message datatype that represents messages in the IDE.
  • ParseTree: Functions on parse trees.
  • PriorityQueue: A PriorityQueue datatype and associated functions.
  • Resources: A Resource datatype and related functions on Eclipse resources.
  • RSF: Functions for reading/writing the Rigi Standard Format (RSF).
  • Scripting: Functions for calling the Rascal shell and Rascal evaluator from Rascal programs.
  • ValueIO: Functions for reading and writing values in textual and binary format.
  • Vis: Functions for creating visualizations.
